row.entry: Create a workunit from an ecl file, archive, or dll
Add a workunit to a query set
Remove a query from a query set
Run the given ecl file, archive, dll, wuid, or query
Deactivate the given query alias name
List or manipulate queries and querysets

sect2.title: ecl deploy
sect2.programlisting: ecl deploy --target=roxie --name=FindPersonService findperson.ecl ecl deploy --target=roxie --name=FindPersonService ArchiveQuery.xml ecl deploy --target=roxie --name=FindPersonService libW20120224-125557.so
sect2.para: A hyphen (-) specifies that the object should be read from stdin.

row.entry: Creates a workunit on the HPCC system from the given ECL text, file, archive, shared object, or dll. The workunit is created in the compiled state.
The ECL text file to deploy
The workunit dynamic linked library or shared object to deploy
The target cluster to associate workunit with
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services
The definition to use from legacy ECL repository
Send ecl text to hpcc without generating archive
Add path to locations to search for ecl imports
Add path to locations to search for system libraries

sect2.title: ecl publish
sect2.programlisting: ecl publish --target=roxie --name=FindPersonService -A W20120224-125557 ecl publish --target=roxie --name=FindPersonService -A libW20120224-125557.so ecl publish --target=roxie --name=FindPersonService -A ArchiveQuery.xml ecl publish --target=roxie --name=FindPersonService --activate findperson.ecl
sect2.para: A hyphen (-) specifies that the object should be read from stdin.

row.entry: Publishes a query into a queryset. The query is created by adding a workunit to a queryset and assigning it a query name.
The ECL text file to deploy
The workunit dynamic linked library or shared object to deploy
The target cluster to associate workunit with
Specifies to not request a reload of the Roxie cluster
Value to set for query timeLimit configuration
Value to set for query warnTimeLimit configuration
Value to set for query memoryLimit configuration. Format <mem> as 500000B, 550K, 100M, 10G, or 1T, etc.
Maximum time to wait for cluster finish updating
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services
The definition to use from legacy ECL repository
Send ecl text to hpcc without generating archive
Add path to locations to search for ecl imports
Add path to locations to search for system libraries
executes the supplied ecl unpublish command
The name of queryset containing query to unpublish
The query to remove from query set
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services

sect2.title: ecl run
sect2.programlisting: ecl run --target=thor --input=data.xml --wait=1000 W20120224-125557 ecl run --target=thor --input=data.xml --wait=1000 thor findpersonservice ecl run --target=thor --input=data.xml --wait=1000 ArchiveQuery.xml ecl run --target=thor --input=data.xml --wait=1000 findperson.ecl ecl run --target=thor --input="<request><LName>JONES</LName></request>" findperson.ecl
sect2.para: A hyphen (-) specifies that the object should be read from stdin.

row.entry: executes the supplied ecl run command
The ECL text file to deploy
The workunit dynamic linked library or shared object to deploy
The target cluster to associate workunit with
The file or xml content to use as query input
Maximum time to wait for cluster finish updating (in ms)
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services
The definition to use from legacy ECL repository
Send ecl text to hpcc without generating archive
Sets the result limit for the query, defaults to 100
set an ECL option (equivalent to #OPTION in ECL)
Add path to locations to search for ecl imports
Add path to locations to search for system libraries
Activates a published query. This assigns a query to the active alias with the same name as the query.
The name of queryset containing query to activate
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services
Deactivates a published query by removing an active query alias from the given queryset.
The name of queryset containing alias to deactivate
The active alias to be removed from the queryset
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services

sect2.title: ecl queries list
sect2.programlisting: ecl queries list roxie ecl queries list roxie --target=roxie --show=A

row.entry: Displays a list of the queries in one or more querysets. If a cluster is provided the querysets associated with that cluster will be shown. If no queryset or cluster is specified all querysets are shown.
The name of queryset from which to list queries
The target cluster to associate workunit with
Show only queries with matching flags
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services

sect2.title: ecl queries copy
sect2.programlisting: ecl queries copy thor/findperson thor2 --activate ecl queries copy //192.168.1.10:8010/thor/findperson thor

row.entry: Copies a query from one queryset to another. A query can be copied from one HPCC environment to another by using a path which begins with '//' followed by the IP and Port of the source EclWatch and then followed by the source queryset and query.
Copy a query from one queryset to another
The path of the query to copy using the format: [//ip:port/]queryset/query or queryset/query.
The name of the queryset to which the query should be copied
The target cluster to associate workunit with
Specifies to NOT copy files referenced by the query
Specifies to not request a reload of the Roxie cluster
[true | false] Whether to overwrite existing information - defaults to true
Value to set for query timeLimit configuration
Value to set for query warnTimeLimit configuration
Value to set for query memoryLimit configuration. Format <mem> as 500000B, 550K, 100M, 10G, or 1T, etc.
Maximum time to wait for cluster finish updating (in ms)
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services
Set or update query configuration values
The name of the target queryset
Specifies to not request a reload of the Roxie cluster
Maximum time to wait for cluster finish updating (in ms)
Value to set for query timeLimit configuration
Value to set for query warnTimeLimit configuration
Value to set for query memoryLimit configuration. Format <mem> as 500000B, 550K, 100M, 10G, or 1T, etc.
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services

sect2.title: ecl package add
sect2.programlisting: ecl package add -s=192.168.1.10 roxie mypkg.pkg ecl package add roxie mypkg.pkg --overwrite=false

row.entry: Adds a package to the target cluster
The target to use when adding package information.
The name of the file containing package information.
[true | false] Whether to overwrite existing information - defaults to true
The packagesetid to use. If not set, use <filename>
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services

sect2.title: ecl package copyFiles
sect2.programlisting: ecl package copyFiles --process=myroxie --daliip=192.168.1.10 ecl package copyFiles

row.entry: The copyFiles command will copy any file listed in the package that is not currently known on the cluster. This will NOT load the package information
Copy missing data files to the appropriate cluster
The target containing the packagemap to activate
[true | false] Whether to overwrite existing information - defaults to true
IP Address of of the source Dali to use for file lookups
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services

sect2.title: ecl package delete
sect2.programlisting: ecl package delete --queryset=roxie mypackage.pkg -s=192.168.1.10 ecl package delete --queryset=roxie mypkg.pkg --overwritename=false

row.entry: The name of the queryset to which the information is associated
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services
The activate command will deactivate the currently active packagemap and make the specified package active.
The target containing the packagemap to activate
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services
The activate command will deactivate the currently active packagemap.
The target containing the packagemap to deactivate
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services
The target containing the packagemap to list
The name of the cluster from which to list information. Default is all clusters associated with the Dali server.
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services
The name of the package from which to list information. (Specify either --cluster or packageName)
The name of the cluster from which to list information. (Specify either --cluster or packageName)
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services

sect2.title: ecl roxie attach
sect2.programlisting: ecl roxie attach myroxie ecl roxie detach myroxie
sect2.para: Sends commands to attach, detach, check, or reload a Roxie cluster.

row.entry: Calls the command to execute an action
the name of the cluster's process
Attach or reattach a Roxie cluster to Dali
Detach a Roxie cluster from Dali
Verifies the Roxie nodes have the same state
Reloads the queries on a Roxie process cluster.
Maximum time to wait for cluster finish updating (in ms)
The IP Address of ESP server running eclwatch services
